title: From traditional to innovative integrated aquaculture solutions  A success story from Chilimbene

tasks.task: Supporting the aquaculture and agricultural rehabilitation project in Shilambena, Gaza Province, Mozambique.
subtasks: Plan and execute integrated aquaculture, agriculture, and livestock practices.
Recycle waste and maintain ecological balance in fish farming systems.
Provide training and capacity-building for women and youth in good agricultural practices.
Enhance local food production through diversified crop cultivation (e.g., maize, sweet potatoes) and livestock breeding.
Facilitate understanding of market access and value chain development for farmers.
Collaborate with local stakeholders, such as the Grassa Machel Foundation, to rebuild food systems and address nutrition gaps.
Adapt project strategies in response to challenges like cyclones and the COVID-19 pandemic.

tasks.task: Addressing the decline in fisheries and food affordability in Mozambique.
subtasks: Promote alternative protein sources, such as aquaculture, to improve food security and nutrition.
Encourage the adoption of sustainable fishing practices and improved farming techniques.
Support local businesses and farmers to recover from natural disasters and economic disruptions.

tasks.task: Empowering women and youth in Mozambique through entrepreneurship and skill development.
subtasks: Offer training in aquaculture, agriculture, and livestock management for young people and women.
Train women and youth in agricultural schools on business skills and market-oriented production.
Foster self-reliance and entrepreneurship among participants through capacity building and practical experience.

tasks.task: Implementing integrated farming systems to boost productivity and resilience.
subtasks: Integrate fish farming with crop cultivation and livestock rearing in a mutually beneficial manner.
Utilize waste products from one component (e.g., fish feed waste) as nutrients for another (e.g., crops, livestock).
Develop composting and recycling systems to minimize environmental impact and maximize resource utilization.
